title: EU Imposes New Sanctions on Iranians Over Supplying Drones to Russia
description: Russia has deployed Iranian-made drones in Ukraine since August to attack infrastructure as well as military targets, according to U.S. officials.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: China’s Space Push
description: Plus China’s vaccination pivot and the year’s most stylish “people.”

title: European Union Roiled by Corruption Investigation Linked to Qatar
description: The bloc’s parliament and its executive body are scrambling to manage the fallout as the Belgian authorities continue raids linked to suspected illegal lobbying.

title: Ashley Bickerton, Unflinchingly Honest About His Work and Illness
description: Last words (and works) of the artist diagnosed with ALS in 2021. A devoted surfer, he chose to live remotely in Bali, away from the buzz. It found him anyway.

title: Ukraine Says It Hit Hotel Where Members of Russia’s Wagner Group Gathered
description: The claim could not be independently verified, and there was no immediate comment or confirmation from the Wagner Group.

title: In a Wary Arctic, Norway Starts to See Russian Spies Everywhere
description: Other European countries are too, blurring the line between vigilance and paranoia.

title: Can Australia Save a Rare Reptile by Moving It to a Cooler Place?
description: An experiment to preserve the western swamp tortoise is the latest flash point in a debate over how far humans should go to protect nature as the world warms.

title: A Gunman Kills 3 in Rome, Shocking the City
description: A man opened fire during a condominium meeting killing three women and wounding four people, shocking a country not accustomed to random acts of mass violence.

title: Putin Will Not Hold His Annual Year-End Conference
description: Dmitri S. Peskov, the Russian president’s spokesman, said that the event would not take place, although he held out the possibility that it might be rescheduled for the new year.

title: As Protests Rage, Iran Carries Out a Public Execution
description: Majidreza Rahnavard was hanged after being accused of killing two members of a paramilitary force in the northeastern city of Mashhad.

title: Putin Will Not Hold His Annual Year-End Conference
description: Dmitri S. Peskov, the Russian president’s spokesman, said that the event would not take place, although he held out the possibility that it might be rescheduled for the new year.

title: Snow and Cold Bring Parts of U.K. to a Standstill
description: Unusually freezing temperatures raised concerns about energy costs. Three children died after falling into an icy lake, the police said.

title: Winter Illnesses
description: Covid and flu cases are on the rise.

title: Zelensky Calls Allies Ahead of Key Diplomatic Meetings
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine spoke with world leaders including the presidents of the U.S., France and Turkey on the eve of a virtual G7 gathering. President Biden said the U.S. would help Ukraine with its air defense systems.

title: ‘It Doesn’t Hurt at All’: In China’s New Covid Strategy, Vaccines Matter
description: As the government drops its restrictions, it not only needs to convince people that the virus is nothing to fear, but also that inoculations are essential.

title: Japan Needs Indian Tech Workers. But Do They Need Japan?
description: Recruiters call the push a crucial test of whether the world’s third-largest economy can compete with the U.S. and Europe for global talent.

title: Russia Is Using Old Ukrainian Missiles Against Ukraine, General Says
description: The missiles, returned to Russia in the 1990s under an agreement aimed at assuring Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity, have shown up in rubble.

title: What Happens to the Migrant Workers Who Built the World Cup?
description: The World Cup was a $220 billion construction project powered by migrant workers. We went to Nepal — a major source of labor for Qatar — to find out what’s driving workers to do dangerous jobs that many say they can’t afford to lose.

title: What Will Biden Offer African Leaders at U.S.-Africa Summit?
description: China, Russia, Turkey and the United Arab Emirates are all vying for influence in Africa. What will the Biden administration offer at a summitthat starts Tuesday in Washington?

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: The German aristocrat connected to a plot to overthrow the government.
